content: bear lights shawl a quick one-skein shawl with a touch of simple elegance joanne bint @snowythistleknits 2020 bear lights shawl by snowy thistle knits about knitted in garter stitch this shawl will roll off your needles while the eyelets and drop stitches keep things interesting this is a great project for all skill levels from an adventurous beginner to a veteran shawl knitter the simplicity of this pattern allows your yarn to be the shining star - an elegant and almost effortless solution for that one special skein the stitches in this shawl are not going to get lost in a deeply speckled yarn or your favourite tonal colourway and the satisfying texture will dance across your fingers with any fibre you can get on your needles worked from the top down this shawl increases evenly on both sides adding six stitches every two row to give it the characteristic crescent shape the lace section is charted and written so you can follow your preferred method of instructions 2 bear lights shawl by snowy thistle knits pattern information yarn one 100g skein at least 400m/437yd of fingering weight yarn ​ ​ sample was knitted in bear in sheep s clothing coloured lights on ​ ​ the bear twist base 100% non-superwash corriedale british wool ​ needles us 6 4 mm needles on a long cable - 40 100cm or larger gauge 21 sts and 42 row in garter stitch over 4 10cm knitted flat ​ ​ take measurements after blocking gauge is not terribly important ​ ​ although it may affect the finished size of your shawl ensure your chosen needle and yarn gives you a fabric you are happy with size length 63 depth 13 5 notions stitch markers tapestry needle stitches used garter tab cast-on yarn over garter stitch dropped stitches stretchy bind-off slip-slip-knit 3 bear lights shawl by snowy thistle knits abbreviations co cast on bobble bind off ​ ​ k knit st s stitch es ​ ​ pm place marker sm slip marker ​ ​ rs right side ws wrong side ​ ​ yo yarn over ​ k2tog knit 2 stitches together as one ​ tbl knit through the back leg of the stitch ​ kyok k1 yo k1 in same stitch knit into the front of the stitch without ​ dropping from left needle yo then knit into the same stitch again drop the stitch from the left needle 2 stitches increased ssk slip first stitch on left needle knitwise slip next stitch on left needle ​ knitwise 2 stitches slipped insert left needle into front of these slipped stitches from left to right wrap yarn as normal on right needle to knit together through the back loops pattern notes gauge is not important here as with many shawls though a heavier gauge yarn will produce a larger warmer shawl and will also use more yarn than the sample you can make this shawl larger by repeating the dropped stitch ​ and eyelet sections until
